title: ScholarlyArticle (v0.1-DRAFT) Draft
description: A ScholarlyArticle is an article commonly reporting a scientific research, for instance a journal article or thesis.

Organization.title: Organization (v0.1) Minimum Version
Organization.description: Provides a way to describe bioscience organizations on the World Wide Web. It defines metadata terms that can be used in the code of web pages and applications, and builds on top of existing technologies and standards. The goal of the specification is to make it easier to discover, exchange and integrate life science organization profiles across the Internet.

Person.title: Person (v0.1) Minimum Version
Person.description: The Life Science Person specification provides a way to describe bioscience people on the World Wide Web. It defines a set of metadata and vocabularies, built on top of existing technologies and standards, that can be used to represent the profile information of people in Web pages and applications. The goal of the specification is to make it easier to discover, life science profile information.

CreativeWork.title: CreativeWork
CreativeWork.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

Thing.title: Thing
Thing.description: The most generic type of item.

SemanticAnnotation.title: SemanticAnnotation (v0.1-DRAFT) Minimum Version
SemanticAnnotation.description: A SemanticAnnotation currently corresponds to an expression identified in a ScholarlyArticle and associated to an ontology term. It could apply as well to documents other than ScholarlyArticle, for instant patents and so.

PropertyValue.title: PropertyValue
PropertyValue.description:
A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property.

Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

Language.title: Language
Language.description: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in BCP 47 can be used via the alternateName property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using ComputerLanguage.

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

Trip.title: Trip
Trip.description: A trip or journey. An itinerary of visits to one or more places.

Journal.title: Journal (v0.1-DRAFT) Minimum Version
Journal.description: A Journal is a collection of publication issues, publication volumes or scholarly articles, or possibly, although no commonly, any mix from those mentioned.

PublicationVolume.title: PublicationVolume (v0.1-DRAFT) Minimum Version
PublicationVolume.description: A PublicationVolume is a collection of publication issues, or scholarly articles, or possibly, although no commonly, any mix from those mentioned. It is commonly part of a Journal.

PublicationIssue.title: PublicationIssue (v0.1-DRAFT) Minimum Version
PublicationIssue.description: A PublicationIssue is a collection of publication scholarly articles published as a collection in a publication volume or a journal

alternateName.title: alternateName (Recommended)
alternateName.description: Bioschemas: Any othe name, including alternate identifiers in the form namespace:id such as pmcid:PMC3804025 or pmid:29312824. Schema.org: An alias for the item.

alternativeHeadline.title: alternativeHeadline (Optional)
alternativeHeadline.description: Schema.org: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

articleBody.title: articleBody (Optional)
articleBody.description: Bioschemas: If included, could be separated in paragraphs or so. Schema.org: The actual body of the article.

articleSection.title: articleSection (Optional)
articleSection.description: Schema.org: Articles may belong to one or more 'sections' in a magazine or newspaper, such as Sports, Lifestyle, etc.

author.title: author (Recommended)
author.description: Schema.org: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

backstory.title: backstory (Recommended)
backstory.description: Bioschemas: Abstract. Schema.org: For an Article, typically a NewsArticle, the backstory property provides a textual summary giving a brief explanation of why and how an article was created. In a journalistic setting this could include information about reporting process, methods, interviews, data sources, etc.

citation.title: citation (Recommended)
citation.description: Schema.org: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

about.title: about (Recommended)
about.description: Bioschemas: Semantic annotations identified in this scholarly article. Schema.org: The subject matter of the content. Inverse property: subjectOf.

copyrightHolder.title: copyrightHolder (Optional)
copyrightHolder.description: Schema.org: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

copyrightYear.title: copyrightYear (Optional)
copyrightYear.description: Schema.org: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

dateCreated.title: dateCreated (Recommended)
dateCreated.description: Schema.org: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

dateModified.title: dateModified (Recommended)
dateModified.description: Schema.org: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

headline.title: headline (Minimum)
headline.description: Bioschemas: Title of the article. Schema.org: Headline of the article.

identifier.title: identifier (Minimum)
identifier.description: Bioschemas: A global a unique identifier for articles in their DOI. Any other identifier can be included as an alternate name. Schema.org: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](http://schema.org/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

inLanguage.title: inLanguage (Optional)
inLanguage.description: Schema.org: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also availableLanguage. Supersedes language.

isAccessibleForFree.title: isAccessibleForFree (Optional)
isAccessibleForFree.description: Schema.org: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free. Supersedes free.

isBasedOn.title: isBasedOn (Recommended)
isBasedOn.description: Bioschemas: Any previous version of this scholarly article. Schema.org: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html. Supersedes isBasedOnUrl.

isPartOf.title: isPartOf (Recommended)
isPartOf.description:
Bioschemas: We recommend at least to inlcude a link to the lowest level possible, i.e., PublicationIssue. It is also possible to use 'isPartOf' to link as well directly to the PublicationVolume or the Journal, making it easier to find links to each other. Schema.org: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense), is part of.
 Inverse property: hasPart.

keywords.title: keywords (Recommended)
keywords.description: Schema.org: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

license.title: license (Recommended)
license.description: Schema.org: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

pageEnd.title: pageEnd (Recommended)
pageEnd.description: Schema.org: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

pageStart.title: pageStart (Recommended)
pageStart.description: Schema.org: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

pagination.title: pagination (Optional)
pagination.description: Schema.org: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

sameAs.title: sameAs (Optional)
sameAs.description: Bioschemas: Any other link to this article, including those machine readable. Schema.org: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

url.title: url (Recommended)
url.description: Bioschemas: DOI is the recommended URL, any other should go as sameAs. Schema.org: URL of the item.

version.title: version (Optional)
version.description: Schema.org: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

wordCount.title: wordCount (Optional)
wordCount.description: Schema.org: The number of words in the text of the Article.
